title: ‘Plumbers’ rifle through sex toys in customer’s bedside drawer
text:
Three sex toys were thrown on the bed by the men

Two men wearing Pimlico Plumbers uniform have filmed themselves rifling through a woman’s dildo drawer.

They can be heard calling the unknown customer a ‘dirty slag’ and saying ‘she loves it’ as they unearth a pack of Viagra from a bedside cupboard.

One then picks up a smaller dildo and says ‘they’re in cases, that one you can touch’ before throwing it on the bed with the others.

His friend tells him, ‘You better f***ing know these all go back’ before shouting ‘Oh no!’ as one of the sex toys falls off the bed onto the floor.

They are both seen wearing what appears to be the blue uniform typically worn by tradesmen employed by Pimlico Plumbers, the London-based firm founded by self-made millionaire Charlie Mullins 40 years ago.

A man wearing a Pimlico Plumbers polo lines up the dildos on the bed

The man holds up one of the smaller sex toys for the camera

As one of the men leans over to put a dildo on the bed, the plumber’s light blue sleeve and company logo briefly comes into view.

It is believed the footage has been circulated around plumber group chats on social media, but it is not known where or when it was taken.

Pimlico Plumbers said they ‘extremely’ doubt the video is genuine and may be the actions of people who want to tarnish the company’s reputation.

A spokesperson also suggested the suspects could have bought the company’s uniform online, which is available to buy from its merchandise website.

One of the men was seen wearing a Pimlico Plumbers polo like this (File picture: PA)

Pimlico Plumbers sells branded merchandise on its website (Picture: Pimlico Plumbers)

However, the trousers and top worn by the men in the video are not currently available to buy on the website, which sells various branded clothing, including hoodies, t-shirts and tracksuit bottoms.

A spokesperson said: ‘We are extremely doubtful that this video is genuine and there is no evidence to prove that the individuals have worked for the company, it is possible to buy our branded clothing online.

‘We believe it may be the actions of people who, for their own reasons, want to tarnish the reputation of the business.

‘If it is proven to be authentic, it does not reflect the high standards we set for our workforce and the strongest action would be taken.’
